wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Gallogley (9 April 1890 – 1976) was a Scottish professional footballer who scored 10 goals from 83 appearances in the Football League playing for Plymouth Argyle and Exeter City in the 1920s. He played as an inside forward.Gallogley was born in Larkhall, South Lanarkshire. He played football for Bedlay Juniors before coming to England in 1913 to play for Plymouth Argyle, then a Southern League club. In a career interrupted by World War I, he made 136 appearances for the club in all competitions, including 62 spread across three seasons in the Football League. During the war he played as a guest for Airdrieonians, Albion Rovers and Vale of Leven. Gallogley played his last game for Argyle in 1923, and then spent a season with Exeter City.He then returned to Scotland, where he was on the books of Dumfries club Queen of the South and Albion Rovers. He died in 1976.
